__e: Oh my God, Lou, you can't tell anyone!

I know you are, but I'm not.
Lou, I don't think this is really the best time.
Hey, Lou, did I tell you this was a good kid?
Lou's going by his place right now.
I just gotta talk to Lou, it's time.
- Let me see what Lou's doing. - Good.
Oh, my God, Lou, what are you doing?
Oh, another of those confounded heart things.
And I could use a hand setting up my stuff in Lou's office.
Well, what do you care if I gave Lou the money?

Oh, another of those confounded heart things.
- Lou and I are interested in having a child.
I'll go and see how Mary Lou's getting along... then I'll come back and tuck you in, huh?

I know who killed Uncle Lou, and I think you do, too, dad.
I'll go and see how Mary Lou's getting along... then I'll come back and tuck you in, huh?
All right, I'll talk to Lou and see if we can manage for a day without you.
Lou, I... I can't believe how much work you got done since I was here last. Well, I had a lot of help.
I thought you should know that... Lou wasn't exactly happy with the idea but... it was the one who really didn't want to go.

Dear Lou, I'm not around anymore, so knowing that might be the case, I wanted to take the time to tell you how I really feel about you, not only as a lifelong friend, but as the guardian of my beloved children.
